author: .vbuterin
content: These are really great docs, thank you!!

author: potuz
content: out of curiosity, what's the 2-torsion of these curves?

author: kevaundray
content: The small order subgroup is isomorphic to the klein-4 group or Z2XZ2 . The actual elements in that group are the identity point (0,1), a order 2 point (0,-1) and 2 exceptional points of order 2

author: potuz
content: Thanks, from reading your document it seemed you have been assuming that it was Klein's 4 group, didn't know if this was obviously known or not.

author: kevaundray
content: Ah right, thats a good point, it could have been Z4. I think there is a proof that shows that this cannot happen if the curve is incomplete

author: kevaundray
content: (I'll put this in my notes for refactoring as I don't think I wrote that proof down)
